intro: Cnestis stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cnestis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
